sen.e: Gomyo (750 - October 20, 834) was a Hosso sect monk of Japanese Buddhism, who lived from the Nara period to early Heian period.

sen.j: はじめ美濃国分寺の道興に師事し、その後奈良元興寺の万耀・勝悟について法相をまなび、また吉野で山岳修行を行った。
sen.e: Gomyo first studied under Doko in Minokokubun-ji Temple, and then studied Hosso under Shogo and 万耀 of Gango-ji Temple in Nara, followed by mountain ascetic practices in Yoshino.

sen.e: When the foundation of a Kaidan was approved of in 823, he lived in seclusion at Yamada-dera Temple, but was called out by Emperor Junna and was then actively involved in the national political arena..
